image.altText: A woman with a tube in her nose and in a hospital bed.

props.synopsis: SA women with endometriosis are experiencing long delays in diagnosis and treatment because of problems accessing medical services, as well as a lack of awareness, a parliamentary inquiry finds.

title.children: Endometriosis sufferers experiencing delays in SA for treatment and diagnosis

image.altText: A smiling woman wearing a yellow top stands in front of a field of yellow flowers

props.synopsis: A mother charged with the attempted murder of her two sons after stabbing them multiple times on an Adelaide motorway has been found not guilty by way of mental incompetence.

title.children: Mother who stabbed her two sons found not guilty by way of mental incompetence

image.altText: A state MP surrounded by journalists outside court.

props.synopsis: Fraud and theft offending by a South Australian MP was fuelled by "greed" and has so far cost him his family home and more than $800,000 in legal fees, a court hears.

title.children: Fraudster MP who stole more than $430k motivated by 'greed', court told

image.altText: A man stands in front of a white wall in american prison

props.synopsis: Former Adelaide megachurch pastor Daniel Menelaou, who was last week charged in the US with possession of child sexual abuse material, has been banned from working with children in SA.

title.children: Pastor arrested in US for alleged abuse banned from working with children

image.altText: A view of the Royal Adelaide Hospital.

props.synopsis: Doctors and nurses say patient care could be compromised if the SA government pushes ahead with plans to shift the infectious diseases unit out of Adelaide’s biggest public hospital and move it to a site across the road.

title.children: Hospital 'Tetris puzzle' could put SA patients at risk, tribunal hears

image.altText: Three young children jumping in a puddle on an otherwise dry ground with a tractor in the background

props.synopsis: Many South Australians awoke to the almost unfamiliar sound of rain hitting their roofs as parts of Adelaide experienced falls of 10mm, and the state's west recorded even higher totals.

title.children: Adelaide welcomes wettest weather in more than 100 days amid SA rain

image.altText: A firefighting volunteer wearing a fedora hat

props.synopsis: Volunteer firefighters and their support staff have travelled more than 1,000 kilometres to help small towns fighting fires in South Australia's south-east.

title.children: Tents, mates, and big breakfasts for travelling volunteers helping firies

image.altText: Trucks and car travelling along a major road

props.synopsis: Community calls for a full duplication of the Sturt Highway have been back by South Australia's peak motoring body, which says planning needs to start now for the project to be realised.

title.children: Business owner's pre-election plea for highway duplication and safety

image.altText: A woman wearing traditional Arab dress walking down a road with two buckets full of supplies.

props.synopsis: Israel's return to fighting in Gaza is forcing the displacement of tens of thousands of Palestinians, as Hamas fires back for the first time since the ceasefire was shattered.

title.children: At least 91 killed in third deadly day of Israeli air strikes in Gaza

image.altText: Large Canadian flag waving over a cityscape with highways and industrial buildings in the background.

props.synopsis: China justified its actions, stating the execution was "in accordance with the law".

title.children: China defends executions of four Canadians

image.altText: A Woolworths sign next to a Coles sign outside the shops

props.synopsis: The consumer watchdog's hotly anticipated report into Australian supermarkets concludes the two major players have so much power, they don't need to compete "vigorously", but the ACCC stopped short of declaring grocery prices excessive.

title.children: Woolies and Coles have 'limited incentive' to compete hard on price, ACCC finds

image.altText: Close-up of woman's face looking serious at a playground

props.synopsis: Families and former workers say staffing ratios and profits are jeopardising good care at South Australian childcare centres, as data shows serious incidents are on the rise.

title.children: Child found sleeping in the sun at childcare, grandmother says

image.altText: A young woman embraces her medical equipment.

props.synopsis: Young South Australian woman Annaliese Holland is terminally ill, but she says being able to plan ahead has given her a sense of empowerment.

title.children: Annaliese likens her life to a 'field of landmines' — but planning has brought her peace

image.altText: A group of people stand around a man in a suit speaking into a microphone at a press conference.

props.synopsis: Farmers pushed to the brink by drought have joined the state opposition on the steps of Adelaide's Parliament House calling for more government action.

title.children: SA farmers take 'gut-wrenchingly hard' drought battle to parliament

image.altText: Nishan Velupillay  celebrates a Socceroos goal against Indonesia.

props.synopsis: The Socceroos remain a work in progress, according to coach Tony Popopvic, after a posting a 5-1 win over Indonesia in their latest World Cup qualifier in Sydney.

title.children: Socceroos taking 'strides forward' towards securing World Cup qualification

image.altText: Tanya Pliberserk with her hands in the air as it starts to rain at a press conference.

props.synopsis: A referendum dies before it is born, US drug makers find an enemy in both of Australia’s major parties and a popular Labor minister’s charms are useless in Tasmania.

title.children: How sought-after Plibersek became persona non grata in a key seat

image.altText: Headshot of a bald black man wearing glasses, suit and tie

props.synopsis: Jimmy Maladina had been accused of assaulting a woman in Sydney but prosecutors have dropped the charge.

title.children: 'Speaks for itself': Assault charge against PNG minister dropped

image.altText: A woman in a large demonstration, sitting on the shoulders of another protester holding a Turkish flag.

props.synopsis: The Turkish government says it has arrested dozens of people over "provocative" social media posts, after a string of arrests of opposition figures.

title.children: Protesters march on Türkiye's streets after arrest of Istanbul mayor

image.altText: 3D graphic map showing two wide cones extended out from each other.

props.synopsis: Physicists may need to come up with a new theory for how the universe works, after a dark energy experiment has produced confounding results.

title.children: Largest 3D map of the universe hints dark energy is becoming weaker

image.altText: Anthony Albanese press conference

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese and Opposition Leader Peter Dutton say the Pharmaceutical Benefits Scheme, a cornerstone of Australia's health system, will never be a negotiating chip in US President Donald Trump's ongoing tariff campaign.

title.children: Labor and Coalition vow PBS will not be bargained over in US trade war

image.altText: A young woman wearing a purple dress and a necklace smiles as she sits at a pub table with some food

props.synopsis: Chilling video footage of the lead up to Lilie James's brutal murder at a Sydney high school has been released as part of an inquest into her death.

title.children: Lilie James inquest releases CCTV as parents pay emotional tribute

image.altText: The founders of Ben and Jerry's holding a tub of Ice Cream

props.synopsis: The ice cream maker has once again clashed with its parent company Unilever over its stance on Gaza, claiming its CEO was unlawfully dismissed.

title.children: Ben & Jerry's says its CEO was sacked for activism. How did we get here?

image.altText: A man wearing a khaki fleece is handcuffed behind his back. A man in a blue tee holds his arm

props.synopsis: The Trump administration has drawn pushback for attempting to deport a permanent resident under an obscure and untested Cold War-era statute. Here's what to know.

title.children: Whisked away and facing deportation, this man could become a thorn in Trump's side

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: Seth Rogen looks to the left with an anxious expression on his face while light streams above him.

props.synopsis: Five new shows to watch this month, including the highly anticipated Seth Rogen comedy and a murder mystery set at the White House.

title.children: Seth Rogen's star-studded new Hollywood satire is delightfully excruciating

image.altText: Mabior Chol leaps in celebration of a goal

props.synopsis: Carlton threw its best at the ladder-leading Hawks but the skill and solidity of Hawthorn proved too much for the Blues at the MCG.

title.children: Hollywood Hawks leave Blues in their wake in bruising MCG clash

image.altText: People wearing masks looking sad on a red bus in London

props.synopsis: The top 10 happiest countries have been announced, with some nations ranking for the first time.

title.children: Australia no longer one of the world's top 10 happiest countries

image.altText: Dyson Daniels, LeBron James and Joel Embiid

props.synopsis: Dyson Daniels does things not seen in decades and a trade re-opens LeBron James's title window, as the Philadelphia 76ers continue to pay for an ill-fated signing. Here are your NBA quick hits as the playoffs approach.

title.children: Daniels continues historic tear, LeBron sniffs title and old trade haunts 76ers

image.altText: Dutton lowy institute

props.synopsis: The opposition leader has also escalated his criticism of China and taken aim at the prime minister's willingness to send peacekeeping troops to Ukraine in a major foreign policy speech at the Lowy Institute.

title.children: Dutton confident he can find 'common ground' with Trump

image.altText: A pair of stained shorts with multiple holes.

props.synopsis: Female prisoners in a safety unit are subjected to degrading conditions, with menstrual blood seen on women, beds and cells, a new report says.

title.children: Prisoners hold pads between their legs in 'degrading' treatment

image.altText: A number of people cross an intersection in Brisbane's CBD. Behind them are office buildings.

props.synopsis: Australia's unemployment rate remained steady at 4.1 per cent in February, as labour force participation declined from a record high.

title.children: 'No reason to panic': Unemployment rate steady despite shock job losses

image.altText: Black badges on an olive green backdrop with the words 'It's not over yet search on MH370' with an image of a plane

props.synopsis: A US-based marine robotics company will be paid $110.2 million if it locates the flight's wreckage in a new 15,000-square-kilometre site in the southern Indian Ocean

title.children: New Malaysia Airlines flight MH370 search approved by government

image.altText: Dead silver fish lying in the sand among sea weed.

props.synopsis: Thousands of small fish have washed up on beaches all along the NSW south coast and experts don't know why.

title.children: Mystery as thousands of dead juvenile fish wash up on beaches

image.altText: protestors in a creek stand off in front of armed police officers

props.synopsis: Greenpeace must pay substantial damages for defamation and other claims brought by a oil pipeline company over the Standing Rock protests in 2016 and 2017.

title.children: Greenpeace must pay $1 billion in damages, could go bankrupt

image.altText: sofronoff

props.synopsis: A legal bid to skewer corruption findings against retired judge Walter Sofronoff argues he could not be held in contempt of his own inquiry.

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann prosecution inquiry chair defends contact with journalists
